availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fred Guy (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky soldier. Married to Anne E. Briner Guy in Jefferson County, Kentucky on January 11, 1863. Served in the 26th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 3rd Sergeant from March 5, 1862 to April 10, 1862. Served in the 26th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 2nd Lieutenant from April 10, 1862 to April 20, 1862. Served in the 26th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st Lieutenant from April 20, 1862 to July 27, 1863. Served in the 26th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from July 27, 1863 to

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819616, p. 271 of 333 of microfilm.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 377.
